children.subject:
At least as of this semester, the data 8 prerequisite is not strictly enforced for data 100. As long as you have a slight stats background and are comfortable (being very comfortable will make your life much easier) with Python you should be fine.

To answer more your actual question, it's hard to say whether it's too much, because some people are Berkeley can take 4 tech electives at once with no problems (I am definitely not one of those people), and others struggle. I will say that 61C is a pretty demanding class. The hw and projects are decently time consuming (moreso than 61B for most) and the topics are usually pretty new to most students, so the exams can be pretty tough. I didn't take it over the summer, though, so that's just my experience during a regular semester.

Yeah for Spring 2019, Data 8 wasn't enforced as a prereq (not sure about Fall 2019, maybe ask in the Data 001 Piazza?). You definitely don't need Data 8 to do well in Data 100 though.
61C over the summer will be very intense but if you're only doing Data 8 and 61c with no other commitments, you should be able to manage.

I think you can not enroll these two courses together during summer? Because there will be time conflict and 61C's instructor has set that we can't do concurrent enrollment.

(CORRECT ME IF I AM WRONG! I ALSO WANT TO TAKE THESE TWO CLASSES TOGETHER....)

history.content: 61C is a challenging course, and this is especially so in the summer - it's a lot of material packed into a small time (as a 61c TA, can def confirm this is the case). I usually recommend ppl to take nothing else along w/ 61C over summer due to this, but I think data8 shouldn't be too challenging given the courses you've taken (I haven't taken this personally so can't really speak to data8). So I think this schedule is certainly doable, but it depends on what else you're doing over summer - if you're doing research or smth that you expect would eat up most of your time, I would encourage caution.

Would taking these two courses be too much over summer? I've taken CS70,EE16AB, CS61AB, MATH53&54. 

The reason why I would like to take it over the summer is because I want to try and take DATA100 in the fall but I saw that DATA8 is a prerequisite.
history.subject: CS61C and DATA8 over summer
